info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 21 at 8:59PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern McDowell, north central Rutherford and south central Burke Counties through 945 PM EDT... At 859 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 10 miles south of Marion, moving northeast at 5 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... South Mountains State Park, Glenwood, Thermal City, Fero, Dysartsville and Union Mills. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
